body:
Saint Abibas

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Saint Abibas
Died 1st Century
Venerated in Catholic Church
Canonized Pre-Congregation
Feast August 3

Saint Abibas (also known as Abibo or Abibus ) is a first-century pre-congregation saint.

Life [ edit ]

Not much is known about St. Abibas's life. He was the second son of Gamaliel , a leading member of the Sanhedrin in the early first century. [1] After being baptized alongside his father he died at the age of twenty of natural causes. [2]

Body [ edit ]

In 415, Abibas's body was found alongside those of Saint Stephen , Saint Nicodemus , and his father in Capergamela, a town twenty miles from Jerusalem . [3]

References [ edit ]

  1. ^ "Saint Abibas" . CatholicSaints.Info . 29 April 2012 . Retrieved 8 March 2020 .
  2. ^ Paton James Gloag, A Critical and Exegetical Commentary on The Acts of the Apostles , Volume 1, page 191, citing Photius, Cod. 171 (Edinburgh: T & T Clark, 1870).
  3. ^ "Book of Saints – Abibo" . Catholic Saints Info . Retrieved 8 March 2020 .
